title: Still in love with you
author: Tasneem Kagalwalla

sentences.98e9: Every morning;my breath speaks of mintbut the air I breathe is full of youmy mouth is painted, a strawberry huebut I can still taste youI wear perfumebut my skin still exudes youyou’ve left your scent on meI still smell of youI don’t know what to doevery thought carries a whiff of you.

sentences.398c: At night too;I sleep in lingerie newbut the bedsheets still reek of youmy eyes, they closebut I still clearly see youmy dreams tooare visions of me and youevery day is the same, as if on cuelife is looping moments of déjà vuI thought I’d get over youbut clearly, I’m still in love with you.

sentences.6658: For more find me @Tasneem Kagalwalla on FB, Twitter and Instagram.

content: Still in love with you Every morning;my breath speaks of mintbut the air I breathe is full of youmy mouth is painted, a strawberry huebut I can still taste youI wear perfumebut my skin still exudes youyou’ve left your scent on meI still smell of youI don’t know what to doevery thought carries a whiff of you. At night too;I sleep in lingerie newbut the bedsheets still reek of youmy eyes, they closebut I still clearly see youmy dreams tooare visions of me and youevery day is the same, as if on cuelife is looping moments of déjà vuI thought I’d get over youbut clearly, I’m still in love with you. For more find me @Tasneem Kagalwalla on FB, Twitter and Instagram.
